name: GM Mobility Reimbursement Program
description: Up to $1,500 reimbursement for adaptive equipment on new GM vehicles
fullDescription: General Motors offers up to $1,500 reimbursement for adaptive equipment installation on new Chevrolet, Buick, Cadillac, or GMC vehicles.
whatTheyOffer:
- Up to $1,500 reimbursement for adaptive equipment
- Applies to Chevrolet, Buick, Cadillac, GMC vehicles
- Covers hand controls, wheelchair lifts, and more
- Available on new vehicle purchase or lease
- No pre-approval required
howToGetIt:
1. Purchase or lease new eligible GM vehicle
2. Have adaptive equipment installed by qualified installer
3. Complete reimbursement application
4. Submit receipts and documentation
5. Mail to GM Mobility Program
6. Receive reimbursement check (6-8 weeks)
keywords: GM, Chevrolet, Buick, Cadillac, GMC, mobility, adaptive equipment, disability, reimbursement
